etymologies: mid 16th century: via French and Latin from Greek akoniton

definitions: a poisonous plant of the buttercup family, which bears hooded pink or purple flowers. It is native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere.

notes.text: Genus Aconitum, family Ranunculaceae: many species, including monkshood and wolfsbane

definitions: an extract of aconite, used as a poison or in medicinal preparations.
shortDefinitions: extract of such plant, used as poison or in medicinal preparations
